name: content
title: Content API for Shopping
description: Manages product items, inventory, and Merchant Center accounts for Google Shopping.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "content#ordersUpdateMerchantOrderIdResponse".

fields.name: executionStatus
fields.desc: The status of the execution.

fields.name: daysToReturn
fields.desc: How many days later the item can be returned.

fields.name: isReturnable
fields.desc: Whether the item is returnable.

fields.name: policyUrl
fields.desc: URL of the item return policy.

fields.name: executionStatus
fields.desc: The status of the execution.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "content#ordersReturnLineItemResponse".

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "content#ordersListResponse".

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: The token for the retrieval of the next page of orders.

fields.name: dimension
fields.desc: The dimension of the variant.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The value for the dimension.

fields.name: executionStatus
fields.desc: The status of the execution.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "content#ordersCancelResponse".

fields.name: testOrder
fields.desc: The test order to create.

fields.name: templateName
fields.desc: The test order template to use. Specify as an alternative to testOrder as a shortcut for retrieving a template and then creating an order using that template.

fields.name: lineItemId
fields.desc: The ID of the line item to return.

fields.name: quantity
fields.desc: The quantity to return.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc: The reason for the return.

fields.name: reasonText
fields.desc: The explanation of the reason.

fields.name: entries
fields.desc: The result of the execution of the batch requests.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "content#ordersCustomBatchResponse".

fields.name: title
fields.desc: The title of the product.

fields.name: brand
fields.desc: Brand of the item.

fields.name: gtin
fields.desc: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) of the item. Optional.

fields.name: itemGroupId
fields.desc: Shared identifier for all variants of the same product. Optional.

fields.name: mpn
fields.desc: Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the item. Optional.

fields.name: price
fields.desc: The price for the product.

fields.name: targetCountry
fields.desc: The CLDR territory code of the target country of the product.

fields.name: variantAttributes
fields.desc: Variant attributes for the item. Optional.

fields.name: channel
fields.desc: The item's channel.

fields.name: condition
fields.desc: Condition or state of the item.

fields.name: contentLanguage
fields.desc: The two-letter ISO 639-1 language code for the item.

fields.name: imageLink
fields.desc: URL of an image of the item.

fields.name: offerId
fields.desc: An identifier of the item.

fields.name: email
fields.desc: Email address of the customer.

fields.name: explicitMarketingPreference
fields.desc: If set, this indicates the user explicitly chose to opt in or out of providing marketing rights to the merchant. If unset, this indicates the user has already made this choice in a previous purchase, and was thus not shown the marketing right opt in/out checkbox during the checkout flow.

fields.name: fullName
fields.desc: Full name of the customer.

fields.name: carrier
fields.desc: The carrier handling the shipment. Not updated if missing.

fields.name: shipmentId
fields.desc: The ID of the shipment.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: New status for the shipment. Not updated if missing.

fields.name: trackingId
fields.desc: The tracking id for the shipment. Not updated if missing.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc: The reason for the cancellation.

fields.name: reasonText
fields.desc: The explanation of the reason.

fields.name: entries
fields.desc: The request entries to be processed in the batch.

fields.name: reasonText
fields.desc: The explanation of the reason.

fields.name: amount
fields.desc: Amount to refund for the cancelation. Optional. If not set, Google will calculate the default based on the price and tax of the items involved. The amount must not be larger than the net amount left on the order.

fields.name: lineItemId
fields.desc: The ID of the line item to cancel.

fields.name: operationId
fields.desc: The ID of the operation. Unique across all operations for a given order.

fields.name: reason

fields.desc: The ID of the request entry this entry responds to.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc: The reason for the cancellation. Orders that are cancelled with a noInventory reason will lead to the removal of the product from POG until you make an update to that product. This will not affect your Shopping ads.

fields.name: reasonText
fields.desc: The explanation of the reason.

fields.name: merchantOrderId
fields.desc: The merchant order id to be assigned to the order. Must be unique per merchant.

fields.name: cancellations
fields.desc: Cancellations of the line item.

fields.name: id

fields.name: quantityCanceled

fields.name: quantityReturned
fields.desc: Number of items returned.

fields.name: product

fields.name: quantityOrdered
fields.desc: Number of items ordered.

fields.name: quantityPending

fields.name: returnInfo

fields.name: returns
fields.desc: Returns of the line item.

fields.name: shippingDetails
fields.desc: Details of the requested shipping for the line item.

fields.name: quantityShipped
fields.desc: Number of items shipped.

fields.name: price
fields.desc: Total price for the line item. For example, if two items for $10 are purchased, the total price will be $20.

fields.name: quantityDelivered
fields.desc: Number of items delivered.

fields.name: tax
fields.desc: Total tax amount for the line item. For example, if two items are purchased, and each have a cost tax of $2, the total tax amount will be $4.

fields.name: trackingId
fields.desc: The tracking id for the shipment.

fields.name: carrier
fields.desc: The carrier handling the shipment.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.desc: Line items to ship.

fields.name: shipmentId
fields.desc: The ID of the shipment.

fields.name: redemptionChannel
fields.desc: Indicates that the promotion is valid online.

fields.name: effectiveDates
fields.desc:
The date and time frame when the promotion is active and ready for validation review. Note that the promotion live time may be delayed for a few hours due to the validation review.
Start date and end date are separated by a forward slash (/). The start date is specified by the format (YYYY-MM-DD), followed by the letter ?T?, the time of the day when the sale starts (in Greenwich Mean Time, GMT), followed by an expression of the time zone for the sale. The end date is in the same format.

fields.name: genericRedemptionCode
fields.desc: Optional. The text code that corresponds to the promotion when applied on the retailer?s website.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique ID of the promotion.

fields.name: longTitle
fields.desc: The full title of the promotion.

fields.name: productApplicability
fields.desc: Whether the promotion is applicable to all products or only specific products.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc: The reason for the refund.

fields.name: reasonText
fields.desc: The explanation of the reason.

fields.name: actor
fields.desc: The actor that created the refund.

fields.name: amount
fields.desc: The amount that is refunded.

fields.name: creationDate
fields.desc: Date on which the item has been created, in ISO 8601 format.

John Smith
1600 Amphitheatre Parkway
Mountain View, CA, 94043
United States

fields.desc: City, town or commune. May also include dependent localities or sublocalities (e.g. neighborhoods or suburbs).

fields.desc: The card expiration year (4-digit, e.g. 2015).

fields.desc: The last four digits of the card number.

fields.name: phoneNumber
fields.desc: The billing phone number.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of instrument (VISA, Mastercard, etc).

fields.desc: The carrier for the shipping. Optional.

fields.desc: Maximum transit time.

fields.name: methodName

fields.name: minDaysInTransit
fields.desc: Minimum transit time.

fields.desc: The status of the execution.

fields.name: taxImpact

fields.desc: The OfferId(s) that were purchased in this order and map to this specific benefit of the promotion.

fields.desc: Further describes the benefit of the promotion. Note that we will expand on this enumeration as we support new promotion sub-types.

methods.name: returnlineitem
methods.desc: Returns a line item. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: shiplineitems
methods.desc: Marks line item(s) as shipped. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: cancel
methods.desc: Cancels all line items in an order. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order to cancel.

methods.name: createtestorder
methods.desc: Sandbox only. Creates a test order. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

methods.name: getbymerchantorderid
methods.desc: Retrieves an order using merchant order id. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: merchantOrderId
pathParams.desc: The merchant order id to be looked for.

methods.name: acknowledge
methods.desc: Marks an order as acknowledged. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: advancetestorder
methods.desc: Sandbox only. Moves a test order from state "inProgress" to state "pendingShipment". This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the test order to modify.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves an order from your Merchant Center account. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: gettestordertemplate
methods.desc: Sandbox only. Retrieves an order template that can be used to quickly create a new order in sandbox. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: templateName
pathParams.desc: The name of the template to retrieve.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the orders in your Merchant Center account. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

optinalQueryParams.name: placedDateEnd
optinalQueryParams.desc: Obtains orders placed before this date (exclusively), in ISO 8601 format.

optinalQueryParams.name: placedDateStart
optinalQueryParams.desc: Obtains orders placed after this date (inclusively), in ISO 8601 format.

optinalQueryParams.name: statuses
optinalQueryParams.desc: Obtains orders that match any of the specified statuses. Multiple values can be specified with comma separation. Additionally, please note that active is a shortcut for pendingShipment and partiallyShipped, and completed is a shortcut for shipped , partiallyDelivered, delivered, partiallyReturned, returned, and canceled.

optinalQueryParams.name: acknowledged
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Obtains orders that match the acknowledgement status. When set to true, obtains orders that have been acknowledged. When false, obtains orders that have not been acknowledged.
We recommend using this filter set to false, in conjunction with the acknowledge call, such that only un-acknowledged orders are returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc:
The maximum number of orders to return in the response, used for paging. The default value is 25 orders per page, and the maximum allowed value is 250 orders per page.
Known issue: All List calls will return all Orders without limit regardless of the value of this field.

optinalQueryParams.name: orderBy
optinalQueryParams.desc: The ordering of the returned list. The only supported value are placedDate desc and placedDate asc for now, which returns orders sorted by placement date. "placedDate desc" stands for listing orders by placement date, from oldest to most recent. "placedDate asc" stands for listing orders by placement date, from most recent to oldest. In future releases we'll support other sorting criteria.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: The token returned by the previous request.

methods.name: cancellineitem
methods.desc: Cancels a line item. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: custombatch
methods.desc: Retrieves or modifies multiple orders in a single request. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

methods.name: refund
methods.desc: Refund a portion of the order, up to the full amount paid. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order to refund.

methods.name: updatemerchantorderid
methods.desc: Updates the merchant order ID for a given order. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.

methods.name: updateshipment
methods.desc: Updates a shipment's status, carrier, and/or tracking ID. This method can only be called for non-multi-client accounts.

pathParams.name: merchantId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the managing account.

pathParams.name: orderId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the order.
